Info

Project Name Image Description
MediDoc-Translate Built out an open-source, privacy-focused application that helps patients and doctors accurately translate and understand their medical discharge papers and documents in their preferred language.
NeRF Model Wrote and developed my own implementation of a NeRF model with PyTorch. Based my work off of the original NeRF paper. Trained my NeRF model to render angles to create a GIF of a LEGO truck from novel directions.
RISC-V CPU Designed and implemented a CPU in Logism that runs RISC-V assembly instructions. Implemented two-stage pipelining for faster performance.
Handwritten Digit Classifier Wrote a ML classifier on MNIST digits in RISC-V assembly. Implemented the matrix and vector operations such as ReLU, Argmax, and dot products along with loss functions.
Transformer Project Designed and trained my own transformer model from the original paper Attention Is All You Need. Trained my transformer to summarize news articles.
Tocharian Dataset Curated dataset of ancient tocharian texts scraped from the online CEToM database. Created an asynchronous Python script that ran parallelized scraping of Tocharian manuscripts listings and saved in a file. Collaborated with BAIR Research lab in finetuning a LLM model off this Tocharian data.
FactGrid Cuneiform Project Implemented machine learning model to segment and transcribe dataset of 1,000+ annotated Cuneiform tablets for inference with YOLOv8. Curated dataset of cuneiform tablets and wrote data processing for inference and cataloguing results.

Bio

My name is Isaac Hwang. I’m currently a computer science and data science student at UC Berkeley looking to grow as a software engineer. I’m working towards specializing in systems and backend development. I am also a machine learning and statistics enthusiast.
